logo_iconography.primary_logo: Puzzle-piece motif in red alongside the wordmark 'DSPy' in black on white
logo_iconography.usage_guidelines: Always surround by ample whitespace; avoid treatments that distort or recolor the puzzle icon

typography.headings_ui: Modern geometric sans-serif (e.g. Inter, SF Pro, or Studio Feixen Sans)
typography.code_examples: Monospaced (e.g. Courier New, Menlo), with light-gray background

authoritative_precise.description: Explain concepts with clarity; assume readers understand AI fundamentals
authoritative_precise.example: DSPy compiles your high-level modules into optimal prompts

approachable_collaborative.description: Write as though coaching a peer
approachable_collaborative.example: Let's build a RAG pipeline in three lines of code
approachable_collaborative.style: Use inclusive pronouns ('we,' 'you') and active voice

concise_action_oriented.description: Open docs with a TL;DR or 'Getting started' snippet
concise_action_oriented.style: Favor step-by-step instructions over long paragraphs

do: Configure your LM in a single line with `dspy.configure(...)`
Combine modules to build agents that self-improve
Use code examples liberally and highlight key parameters
dont: One might consider setting up the language model
Perhaps you could explore optimizing prompts later
Overload prose with extraneous theory or digressions

style.diagrams_icons: Line-art style, single-color (black or red) illustrations of pipelines, puzzle pieces, or flow-graphs
style.screenshots: Always frame with a white border on a light-gray canvas
style.photography: Abstract tech-backgrounds (circuit motifs, minimal workspaces) desaturated to grayscale; overlay with red highlights sparingly

website_docs.subhead: DSPy is a declarative framework for building modular AI software…

social_marketing.voice: Confident, concise—'Unlock modular AI pipelines in Python'
social_marketing.visual: Logo in DSPy Red on a black or white background; use minimal text overlays
